intro: Disporopsis bakerorum, commonly known as the Baker's disporopsis, is a rare and unique plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. It produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Disporopsis bakerorum is considered a vulnerable species.
